channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Anna Wintour names Chloe Malle as Vogue successor
item.description: Anna Wintour ended weeks of fashion-world speculation Tuesday when she named Chloe Malle her successor as head of editorial content at Vogue —but the ...

item.title: Federal judge orders Google to end exclusive search distribution deals, but won’t force Google to sell Chrome
item.description: The ruling is part of the government’s landmark antitrust case against Google-parent Alphabet

item.title: OpenAI and Meta are fixing how AI chatbots respond to teens in distress
item.description: Artificial intelligence chatbot makers OpenAI and Meta say they are adjusting how their chatbots respond to teenagers asking questions about suicide o...

item.title: 7 strategies to overcome professional self-doubt
item.description: The vast majority of people—85%, to be exact—admit they lack confidence in the workplace : they avoid taking on leadership roles, they don’t speak up ...

item.title: Walmart and Target are allegedly forcing employees to remove tags on apparel to make it easier to jack up prices based on tariffs
item.description: Social media posts claim that removing price tags can allow the retailers to raise prices more easily, possibly in response to tariffs.

item.title: Forget Learning Tech: This Study Shows Soft Skills Are Better for Boosting Your Career as AI Arrives
item.description: With AI flooding offices, you may think brushing up on computing skills is the best way to help your career. The reality of today’s workplace says som...

item.title: LCID price: 1-for-10 reverse stock split couldn’t save Lucid from sinking even more today

item.title: No one is happier it’s Pumpkin Spice Latte season than Starbucks
item.description: For fall fanatics nationwide, the return of Starbucks’ Pumpkin Spice Latte was an August highlight. But it’s safe to say that no one was happier than ...

item.title: 3 reasons why Klarna’s valuation has fallen by nearly 70% from its peak just a few years ago
item.description: Once Europe's most valuable startup and the second-highest fintech at $45.6 billion, it's going public at a $14 billion valuation.

item.title: Stocks are falling towards their worst day in a month amid tech sector declines and tariff concerns
item.description: Wall Street is sinking on Tuesday as rising pressure from the bond market pulls U.S. stocks further from their records.

item.title: Why Bad Onboarding Could Cost Your Business Nearly Half Your New Hires
item.description: Poorly done training and orientation programs leave many fresh hires feeling unprepared to do their new jobs, a study says.

item.title: Paris Hilton took out a mortgage on the $63 million mansion she bought from Mark Wahlberg. Here’s why that’s actually a smart financial decision
item.description: The reality star made a savvy move in financing her megamansion.

item.title: This Survey Just Offered 766 Billion Reasons to Clamp Down on Rudeness at Work
item.description: Rudeness between coworkers is on the rise and getting worse. That could impact your office team building efforts, and your bottom line.

item.title: Humanoid Robots Showcase Their Skills, but They’re on a Long Road to Catch Up to AI
item.description: Robots played soccer, shot arrows, and occasionally froze for a battery change at an event at the birthplace of the Olympic Games.

item.title: AI-Driven Drug Discovery Picks Up as FDA Pushes to Reduce Animal Testing
item.description: Within the next several years, using AI and cutting back on animal testing could reduce drug timelines and costs by at least half.
